name: Bylot Island
description: Configuration preset for Bylot Island glaciers, Nunavut, Arctic Canada

location.description: Bylot Island, Sirmilik National Park, Nunavut, Canada

notes: Bylot Island is located east of northern Baffin Island in the Canadian Arctic
Part of Sirmilik National Park, Nunavut
One of the largest uninhabited islands in the world (11,067 km²)
43% ice covered with extensive glaciation including glacier C93
Ice is centered on the Byam Martin Mountains with radial valley glaciers
The region margin of 2.0° provides good coverage for Arctic glacier analysis
Target resolution of 0.0025° (~275m) matches MISR native resolution
